command: git add <file name> or git add *

description: Pushing the changes to remote repository
command: git remote add origin "<URL to the repository>"
git push origin <name of the branch>

description: To create new branch from an existing branch
command: git branch <name of the new branch>
git branch -D <name of the branch to be deleted>

description: Checking the logs or history of the repository (logs of that particular branch)
To stash your staged files without committing
Once you are back and want to retrieve working
Checking the differences between two versions of a file
command: git commit <commit id of a> <commit id of b>
git config --global user.email <email> &&  git config --global user.name <userid>
